description: After an intense internal struggle, Oksana Lintz makes the decision to release the complete archive of BCI abuses and records of disappeared residents. She prepares the files for public access, aware of the potential for chaos and backlash.
The archive goes live. Residents and families begin to recognize names and stories in the leaked records. Shock and outrage erupt across Stenograd.
Several vanished residents reappear in their neighborhoods, refusing to explain their forced absence and demanding restoration of housing, rights, and a public apology.

Rallies and protests intensify. Survivors and their supporters share details of systematic detentions and wrongful BCI scoring. Credibility of the Council collapses as spontaneous assemblies demand accountability.
In response to mounting pressure, the Council announces a formal inquiry into BCI abuses but is immediately plagued by infighting, leading to mixed messages and growing public skepticism.
